DataElement.preferredName: Bioassay Normal Control Cutoff Probe Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of normal controls used to ascertain a false-positive cutoff.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bioassay Normal Control Cutoff Probe Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test/analysis of biological activity of a substance by studying its effect on an organism or in test tube under controlled conditions.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated.:General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will (hybridize), a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest. (On-line Medical Dictionary):The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The number used to describe norm or standard controls.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)

ReferenceDocuments.name: How many normal controls will
ReferenceDocuments.description: How many normal controls will be used to establish a false-positive cutoff for a given probe?
